channel.title: How To Remove A Xbox 360 game scratch?
channel.description: my mw1 has a circular scratch near the end of the disc. i cant get to "the bog" mission or do some maps on multiplayer. ive heard about all these gay ass ways like put it in a fkin microwave? or rub it with a pickle but i need a real one

item.title: How To Remove A Xbox 360 game scratch?
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Mopar1 Mr Mopar
item.description:
@Mr_Mopar1 wrote:

[quote=“orcashark, post:31, topic:351820”][quote author=Mr Mopar link=topic=448176.msg3291489#msg3291489 date=1280629470]
Rent the same game that is scratched, then return it and keep the good copy.

[/quote]

LOL thats what i said :)[/quote]
Oh I only read a few post’s

Read full topic

item.title: How To Remove A Xbox 360 game scratch?
item.dc:creator: @orcashark orcashark
item.description:
@orcashark wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:28, topic:351820”][quote author=orcashark link=topic=448176.msg3291286#msg3291286 date=1280613144]
Well there is several ways to get rid of it.

  1. Put toothpaste and rubbing alchohal [It sounds dumb but it works]
  2. Rent that game and replace the disk, come back and say “This doesnt work” and get your money back
  3. Add margerine to it [It sounds dumb it the margerine makes it smoother to read, so it will work for abit longer]
  4. Bring it to blockbuster or rogers to get it re-serviced for 3.75

Hope these helped!
[/quote]Or buy a new copy.[/quote]

That too but i thought he wanted to do it without buying a new copy.

Read full topic

Well there is several ways to get rid of it.

Hope these helped!

item.title: How To Remove A Xbox 360 game scratch?
item.dc:creator: @dukaJ_x dukaJ x
item.description:
@dukaJ_x wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:2, topic:351875"][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=448176.msg3289060#msg3289060 date=1280417624]

go to a gamestop and get it buffed. it costs 2-5 dollars.

^ Everyone else is an idiot.
[/quote]

I was told by gamestop themselves that they didn’t do it anymore, I had to go to some other store.

My mw2 disk was scratched days after I got it.[/quote]
Yea, they told me the same too.

Read full topic
item.source: How To Remove A Xbox 360 game scratch?

item.title: How To Remove A Xbox 360 game scratch?
item.dc:creator: @xEvo Exion
item.description:
@xEvo wrote:

[quote=“dukaJ x, post:21, topic:351820”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=448176.msg3289189#msg3289189 date=1280427915]
Already mentioned above, but you can borrow a friend’s disc and install it to your hard drive. When it gives you the option to play the game, just hit ‘Y’ and install it. You can then play the game even with your scratched disc, as it won’t be reading the disc anymore.

I did this yesterday and it works fine (I tipped over my xbox and had the perfect circle scratch). If you don’t want to do that, look at the above posts.

The toothpaste method also doesn’t work, just so you know.
[/quote]

I did the same exact thing, that happened to me too.[/quote]
Same, happened to my MW2 disk, 2 times.

Read full topic
item.source: How To Remove A Xbox 360 game scratch?

item.source: How To Remove A Xbox 360 game scratch?

item.title: How To Remove A Xbox 360 game scratch?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Well, I’m not saying to use this, since I do not know the correct formula, but my friend uses:

[ul][li]Elmers Glue[/li]
[li]Rubbing Alcohol[/li]
[li]Warm Water[/li][/ul]

And a few other things mixed together. It actually has repaired all disks I have sent to him, and one that even had a circular scratch. As mentioned above though, just go to gamestop and get it buffed, or buy one for yourself.

Read full topic
item.source: How To Remove A Xbox 360 game scratch?

item.title: How To Remove A Xbox 360 game scratch?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:10, topic:351820”]Already mentioned above, but you can borrow a friend’s disc and install it to your hard drive. When it gives you the option to play the game, just hit ‘Y’ and install it. You can then play the game even with your scratched disc, as it won’t be reading the disc anymore.

I did this yesterday and it works fine (I tipped over my xbox and had the perfect circle scratch). If you don’t want to do that, look at the above posts.

The toothpaste method also doesn’t work, just so you know. :P[/quote]Actually, it does to an extent. Normal scratches that you get from leaving a disc out can be fixed with it, but the ring scratch it won’t work on.

Read full topic

I did this yesterday and it works fine (I tipped over my xbox and had the perfect circle scratch). If you don’t want to do that, look at the above posts.

The toothpaste method also doesn’t work, just so you know.
